name: Exploring Mir Castle
description: Visit the iconic Mir Castle, a UNESCO World Heritage Site known for its unique blend of Gothic, Baroque, and Renaissance architecture.

name: Touring the Belovezhskaya Pushcha National Park
description: Explore the ancient forest of Belovezhskaya Pushcha, home to the rare European bison and a UNESCO World Heritage Site.

name: Visiting the National Art Museum in Minsk
description: Discover Belarusian and international art at the National Art Museum, featuring a vast collection of paintings and sculptures.

name: Exploring Nesvizh Castle
description: Discover the architectural beauty and rich history of Nesvizh Castle, a cultural heritage and UNESCO World Heritage Site.

name: Walking through Brest Fortress
description: Visit the Brest Fortress, a symbol of Soviet resistance during World War II, now a poignant memorial site.

name: Discovering the Struve Geodetic Arc
description: Explore the Struve Geodetic Arc, a chain of survey triangulations stretching through Belarus and ten other countries.

name: Visiting the Dudutki Museum
description: Experience traditional Belarusian culture and crafts at the Dudutki Museum, an open-air complex showcasing folk heritage.

name: Enjoying the Minsk Sea
description: Relax by the Minsk Sea, a large artificial lake offering recreational activities and scenic beauty.

name: Exploring the Gomel Palace and Park Ensemble
description: Visit the Gomel Palace and Park Ensemble, a historic complex with beautiful gardens, an 18th-century palace, and a chapel.

name: Visiting the Vitebsk Marc Chagall Museum
description: Explore the life and works of Marc Chagall at the museum dedicated to the artist in his hometown of Vitebsk.
